attributes.action: make it illegal for job applicants over 45 to be turned down without a written explanation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: With a growing problem of age discrimination, we the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to make employers and employment agencies legally obliged to provide a written explanation of why an applicant above the age of 45 is turned down for a role that he/she is qualified for.  It should be made obligatory to refer to the applicant’s work experience and industry knowledge as relevant to the applied for role.  Certain key phrases such as "over qualified" or "we believe you would be bored with the role" should be made illegal, with an annual review of newly created euphemisms.  If someone is turned down for a job because of their age, then the agency or employer should be legally obliged to explain this is the case and the reasons why.
